Khan Academy will grow and change teachers' jobs - more students per class, as a coach, tutor and facilitator - less lecturer.  In higher education, there's a platform that's robust to help top universities offer live accredited classes online.  Why can't I take classes from a professors/instructors who make more sense to me, not the one at one school - if have 6 available, let me choose, I do the work and it counts!  Since lectures or interactions are recorded, I can review at my pleasure.

I hope the next president makes this guy the Secretary of Education and lets him revamp the entire "Publik Skool" system. Then maybe I'll send my kids to public school instead spending big bucks on private school. Tell your friends about Khan Academy and save our country!
Google could give Khan Academy a huge boost by featuring it on YouTube's home page for a week, or even a day.

Accreditation processes have played a major role in increasing education costs by restricting the supply of available academic resources in my opinion. I suppose there is an education revolution coming, and I would very much like to be a part of it. I started my college wanting to be a teacher, but what I have seen (the education system), has made me think twice about it. But, with such people like Sal and a few others online, I can do this by myself and not need to degrade myself going through the system.

As I have always said, the term "tutor" is a politically deceptive word meant to separate and make a teacher important and the so called tutor less important. Yes, class interaction between students is important and so is hands-on experience. However, many times (almost infinite) that the teacher-student relationship is lacking, thus I ask what's the point of going to school (wasting gas, food and other resources) when you can get a better understanding seating at home and online.
Who the hell is the one dislike?
